extendedInfo.description: Official app for the American Physical Society (APS) March 2012 Meeting in Boston, Massachusetts. The app contains the scientific program, exhibitors, maps, a personal scheduler, and more!

reviews.title: Downrating.
reviews.comment: The app has downloaded ~175MB over 3G connection during Monday (so i went over my limit.) and was killing the battery in about 4 hours. Uninstalled Tuesday morning. Never again.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Useless and slow.
reviews.comment: You can not bookmark an entire session. After bookmarking some talks you cannot see them without going back into a particular session or time. Don\'t bother.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Useless
reviews.comment: This app is pointless.  Bookmarking events serves no useful purpose. And the social features are pointless. We already have many ways of contacting people.  A crappy app doesn\'t add anything to that.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Needs to list only bookmarked talks
reviews.comment: This app has some useful features and is worth downloading. Yes, it uses a lot of memory, but it runs pretty quickly and does not depend on a fast data connection. It allows bookmarking of talks and has several schedule display modes, but the big problem for me is that there is no way to display ONLY bookmarked talks. Ideally this feature would interface with My Schedule on the APS site. Unless they add this feature before Monday, the app won\'t replace my division\'s printed booklet.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Useful but crashed very frequently.
reviews.comment: All in all a good try and much better than carrying around a printed program.  Better luck next time.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Slow, bloated, and not very useful
reviews.comment: The app takes forever to load, is slow to run, and crashes sometimes. Looking up talks is cumbersome, and the personal schedule view sucks (why was this not a feature in the first version?!) There\'s no way to interface with any other scheduler or calendar, just a useless twitter feed. I really hope the APS didn\'t spend too much on this, because it\'s one of the worst apps I\'ve used.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Why bother
reviews.comment: I set up my schedule online and this can\'t interface with it.  Only useful for viewing by session, but I mostly relied on printed schedule.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Did not use it
reviews.comment: Because this app could not interface with the wonderful scheduler which is on the APIS website, I just used my  smartphone to access the website all the time. This app was useless in comparison.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Lots of room for improvement
reviews.comment: Feels like an app designed by a committee.   Improve the following: make it faster through aggressively memory caching related material. Implement click through navigation so that if I search by author and find a talk I can click a link to see all talks in that session and all talks listing that author, even as secondary author.  Get rid of all that tweet crap. Stop trying to access the internet. It causes the app to freeze.  Maps. Show me on the map where a session is. Show me where the speaker ready room
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Terrible. Don\'t bother.
reviews.comment: Whoever was in charge of this at APS should be fired.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: No good for Nexus One or Acer Iconia A500
reviews.comment: Too large to install in my Nexus One, impossibly slow in my A500.  Since it requires net access anyway, why download all this data when any given user will only use a fraction of it?  A clean mobile website would have been more useful.  App crashed in the background while I was writing this.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Limited usefulness
reviews.comment: No means of setting up a schedule.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crashes during initialization
reviews.comment: Unusable at present on HTC incredible.
reviews.author: A Google User
